item.title: 7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out
item.description:
7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out

Gadgets and devices that make working out more enjoyable, including games, music players, and muscle trackers.

item.title: A Beautiful Speedometer for Bikes
item.description:
A Beautiful Speedometer for Bikes

Shout-out to designers who are also obsessed with cycling because their work frequently results in something new and clever, like the arresting Omata One. Mounted onto a bike, the speedometer's unique analog face informs of the four most relevant ride metrics (speed, distance, ascent and time).

item.title: OneCook Personal Robotic Chef
item.description:
OneCook Personal Robotic Chef

Modern kitchen appliances can brew you the perfect espresso, bake a fluffy loaf of bread, mix a killer cocktail or even blend up a personalized smoothie-all with the press of a single button. So why not program them to cook a full meal? That's exactly what Boston-based company TNL Corp.

item.title: Assignment of a Lifetime: Riding in a U-2 Spy Plane at the Edge of Space
item.description:
Assignment of a Lifetime: Riding in a U-2 Spy Plane at the Edge of Space

Back in 2010, San Francisco-based photographer Christopher Michel received a once-in-a-lifetime photo assignment from the US Navel Institute: to ride in the back seat of a U-2 spy plane at the "edge of space." At the plane's cruising and intelligence-gathering altitude of 70,000 feet above the ground, temperatures outside the plane fall to 70 degrees below zero.

item.title: Space odyssey: photographer Thomas Ruff heads to the moon with new work.
item.description:
Space odyssey: photographer Thomas Ruff heads to the moon with new work.

The DÃ¼sseldorf photographer Thomas Ruff is having his day in the sun, with the Art Gallery of Ontario's 'Object Relations', a major solo show, opening this month. Closer to home, Chelsea's David Zwirner Gallery is celebrating Ruff's latest series of work.
